channel.title: Hotspots on GBIF Data Blog
channel.description: Recent content in Hotspots on GBIF Data Blog

item.title: Biodiversity hotspots and GBIF data
item.description: GBIF organizes and gives statistics for countries and areas, but we do not do a good job of reporting on occurrence data for other areas that might be more biologically relevant or important. Currently the Critical Ecosystem Partnership Fund (CEPF) recognizes 35 biodiversity hotspots. For a region to be considered a hotspot it must: Contain at least 1,500 endemic species of vascular plants (found nowhere else on Earth).
